Description: A local resident living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province, Chhunla is a 27-year-old mother of one child. To make a living, she has been growing rice for 9 years. She can earn more income via selling mushrooms. For a few years, her business did not grow well as the drought affected her crop. Chhunla and her group members are seeking a first loan with VisionFund. As the leader of the group, she will manage her loan portion to buy rice seed, organic pesticide and fertilizer to support her rice farm in order to produce a good yield. She hopes this year her rice can produce a higher yield so that she can sell it at a higher price, which will enable her to save sufficient capital to support her business next year.
Use: to buy rice seed, organic pesticide and fertilizer to support her rice farm in order to produce a good yield.
Keywords:
The most relevant keywords for this loan are:

1.  **Rice Farming**: This is the primary business of the borrower, and the loan is intended to support her rice farm.
2.  **Crop Protection**: The loan will be used to purchase organic pesticide and fertilizer, which suggests that crop protection is a critical aspect of the borrower's business.
3.  **Women Empowerment**: Although not explicitly stated, the fact that the borrower is a 27-year-old mother of one child and is seeking a first loan with VisionFund suggests that women empowerment may be an underlying theme.
4.  **Climate Change**: The description mentions that a drought affected the borrower's crops in previous years, which suggests that climate change may be a relevant theme in this context.
